channel.description:
Love has never been optional!
Jonathan.althoff@yahoo.com is my email
Jrtstudio@yahoo.com is my PayPal
LookingUp.live is my video blog
channel.itunes:keywords: Mindfulness, Jesus, #ChurchUp, freedom, hope, transformation, restoration, revolution, love, energy, challenge

item.itunes:title: Alignment Part 4 - P
item.title: Alignment Part 4 - P
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Audio is a bit different as I changed my position of where I stand, but this message is so dynamic. Afterwards, not many wanted to leave. Excellent conversations about ministry were and are happening. So exciting to watch God at work right in front of my eyes! Support the show www.Turning180.com
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

Audio is a bit different as I changed my position of where I stand, but this message is so dynamic. Afterwards, not many wanted to leave. Excellent conversations about ministry were and are happening. So exciting to watch God at work right in front of my eyes!

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Alignment Part 3 - P
item.title: Alignment Part 3 - P
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Such a strong sermon talking about aligning with the community. The way I preach this series shows a side I haven’t presented, but it is a good one. This sermon marks the day we started to embrace change. Support the show www.Turning180.com
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

Such a strong sermon talking about aligning with the community. The way I preach this series shows a side I haven’t presented, but it is a good one. This sermon marks the day we started to embrace change.

item.itunes:title: Positioning- Alignment #2
item.title: Positioning- Alignment #2
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Moving message with comments like, “ I was filled with joyful tears after this!” Such a dynamic and different feel and style of preaching for me. This also isn’t as clear audio as I stood away from the pulpit to speak. Don’t miss this series!! Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. It’s not a sucker punch, it is a revelation at the end of this message. Support the show www.Turning180.com

The response was quite overwhelming.

item.itunes:title: The Death of Simon - NL
item.title: The Death of Simon - NL
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. If you never listen to any other message, listen to this one. I have never spoke a message this passionate or emotional. There were few, if any, dry eyes. You can hear it in my voice and FEEL it! I was still moved an hour afterwards!! This is probably the best sermon I have ever spoken. I cannot listen to it without being strongly affected. Do yourself a favor and bookmark and come back to this one. It’s not about t...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

If you never listen to any other message, listen to this one. I have never spoke a message this passionate or emotional. There were few, if any, dry eyes. You can hear it in my voice and FEEL it! I was still moved an hour afterwards!! 

This is probably the best sermon I have ever spoken. I cannot listen to it without being strongly affected. Do yourself a favor and bookmark and come back to this one. 

It’s not about the restoration of Peter, it’s about the death of Simon! 

Support the show

www.Turning180.com
item.content:encoded:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

If you never listen to any other message, listen to this one. I have never spoke a message this passionate or emotional. There were few, if any, dry eyes. You can hear it in my voice and FEEL it! I was still moved an hour afterwards!! 

This is probably the best sermon I have ever spoken. I cannot listen to it without being strongly affected. Do yourself a favor and bookmark and come back to this one. 

It’s not about the restoration of Peter, it’s about the death of Simon! 

Support the show

item.itunes:title: Which Fish? - P
item.title: Which Fish? - P
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. God is not a priority. He doesn’t want a relationship with you. At least, not in the way it has been taught. This sermon is, “deep,” “helpful,” and “powerful,” as some said after hearing it. How do you make choices? What is your framework of reference? What’s your agenda? What interests are you guarding? Five stars and worth a second and third listen to make sure the enemy doesn’t steal it away. Do NOT miss this one! List...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

God is not a priority. He doesn’t want a relationship with you. At least, not in the way it has been taught. This sermon is, “deep,” “helpful,” and “powerful,” as some said after hearing it. 

How do you make choices? What is your framework of reference? What’s your agenda? What interests are you guarding?

Five stars and worth a second and third listen to make sure the enemy doesn’t steal it away. Do NOT miss this one! Listen and share. 

Before anything else, listen to this one!

Support the show

www.Turning180.com
item.content:encoded:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

God is not a priority. He doesn’t want a relationship with you. At least, not in the way it has been taught. This sermon is, “deep,” “helpful,” and “powerful,” as some said after hearing it. 

How do you make choices? What is your framework of reference? What’s your agenda? What interests are you guarding?

Five stars and worth a second and third listen to make sure the enemy doesn’t steal it away. Do NOT miss this one! Listen and share. 

Before anything else, listen to this one!

item.itunes:title: He Saw It - NL
item.title: He Saw It - NL
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. 5 Star message. ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ One of my personal favorites. ‘Powerful!!’ Listen to it when you can in one sitting, and make sure you bring Kleenex! You will NEVER forget this message. Yes, it’s that good! I wept when I wrote it, others did when I shared it. Support the show www.Turning180.com
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

5 Star message. ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ One of my personal favorites. ‘Powerful!!’ Listen to it when you can in one sitting, and make sure you bring Kleenex!  You will NEVER forget this message. Yes, it’s that good!

I wept when I wrote it, others did when I shared it. 

Support the show

www.Turning180.com
item.content:encoded:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

5 Star message. ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ One of my personal favorites. ‘Powerful!!’ Listen to it when you can in one sitting, and make sure you bring Kleenex!  You will NEVER forget this message. Yes, it’s that good!

I wept when I wrote it, others did when I shared it.

item.title: Excuses NL
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. ***** 5 Star delivery and message. Not often I say a sermon is don’t miss. This one is just that! The last episode here was phenomenal, and this one was better! It’s hard to imagine a better message ever shared. There were people audibly weeping as this hit home in their lives. Keep following this sermon series and next week’s message which is called “Tipping Point.” Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: The Waiting (one message only)
item.title: The Waiting (one message only)
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. We find in today’s story numerous wounded and broken people waiting for healing. What was their mindset as they waited? How do you wait? What do you do while you’re waiting for an answer? These and other questions are answered in this timely and powerful message. This message was preached in my basement as we canceled in person services at both churches while I recovered from Covid. Support the show www.Turning180.com
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

We find in today’s story numerous wounded and broken people waiting for healing. What was their mindset as they waited? How do you wait? What do you do while you’re waiting for an answer? These and other questions are answered in this timely and powerful message. This message was preached in my basement as we canceled in person services at both churches while I recovered from Covid.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

In this message I share Jesus’ remedy for a troubled heart or mind. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: The Impact
item.title: The Impact
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. This message focuses on how people perceive what we do and say. Most of the time, if we are not strongly in tune with who we are, our words and actions have an unknown affect on others. The impact we make on others is often something we don’t know. To engage in conversation about it changes everything about that relationship. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Risky Business
item.title: Risky Business
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. It is a very dangerous time in the life of Jesus Christ. He has heard word of a friend who is sick, but his friend lives in an area where people are trying to arrest Jesus. Rather than go to his sick friend, he stays where he is a little while longer. Those around him think he’s making a safe move and playing it safe. But, Jesus always engages on the risky business of promoting the gospel. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: The Fold
item.title: The Fold
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. One of the more interesting messages I have spoken. The bold where the sheep are kept the Jesus refers to is Judaism. The door also is a passage in the passage out one time each. For those who are not Judaisitic, the door is just an entry in the pasture that Jesus speaks. This message shares more detail on all of that and why it’s relevant to you and to me. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Known
item.title: Known
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. To be known is the one gift we have been given. We may not like being fully known, but it is the only way to understand the depths of the love extended to us. For some, it’s uncomfortable and scary. For others, it feels unsafe. For some, it feels like a haven long sought. Fully known means all parts of us, not just the good parts. He knows us to remold us and move us into the life planned and offered. Resisting it only mak...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

To be known is the one gift we have been given. We may not like being fully known, but it is the only way to understand the depths of the love extended to us. For some, it’s uncomfortable and scary. For others, it feels unsafe. For some, it feels like a haven long sought. 

Fully known means all parts of us, not just the good parts. He knows us to remold us and move us into the life planned and offered. Resisting it only makes us hide in insecurity and fear. 

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.title: In The Sheepfold
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Life is not always easy. Sometimes we need some help, sometimes we need some encouragement, sometimes we need tenderness, sometimes we need affirmation, sometimes we need thankfulness and sometimes we need responsibilities. No matter what we need, the shepherd will provide. There are all sorts of personalities and this message talks about how each moment in our life we reflect one of them and the shepherd knows how to lead us no ...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

Life is not always easy. Sometimes we need some help, sometimes we need some encouragement, sometimes we need tenderness, sometimes we need affirmation, sometimes we need thankfulness and sometimes we need responsibilities. No matter what we need, the shepherd will provide. There are all sorts of personalities and this message talks about how each moment in our life we reflect one of them and the shepherd knows how to lead us no matter which we are in.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Conflict versus Stagnation
item.title: Conflict versus Stagnation
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Many people think the opposite of conflict is peace. However, that is not true. The opposite of conflict is stagnation. We need conflict to grow, to mature, and to become better people. We are better on the other side of conflict then on the beginning side or never having had any. In this message, I share practical illustrations from the writings of Paul that talk about conflict, resolution, and the ways we grow. Support the sho...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

Many people think the opposite of conflict is peace. However, that is not true. The opposite of conflict is stagnation. We need conflict to grow, to mature, and to become better people. We are better on the other side of conflict then on the beginning side or never having had any.

In this message, I share practical illustrations from the writings of Paul that talk about conflict, resolution, and the ways we grow.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:title: Restoring The Stolen
item.title: Restoring The Stolen
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. This passage talks about the things that are stolen from us: safety, items, trust, our innocence, or anything else. These damages done to us our sins by somebody else. When Jesus has forgiven our sins, these scabs and wounds remain. With guidance from Leviticus and other passages, we learn how to remove the wound and let the scars begin the healing process. There is a prayer for repentance and healing, and an opportunity for lea...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

This passage talks about the things that are stolen from us: safety, items, trust, our innocence, or anything else. These damages done to us our sins by somebody else. When Jesus has forgiven our sins, these scabs and wounds remain. With guidance from Leviticus and other passages, we learn how to remove the wound and let the scars begin the healing process.

There is a prayer for repentance and healing, and an opportunity for leaders and others to reclaim the land, our homes, our families, or ministries, and anything else that has been stolen or damaged.

Let this message bring healing to your land, to your home, to your life, to your family, and to your community.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Redemption First
item.title: Redemption First
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Life of faith starts with redemption, not with commandments, not with right living, and not with trying to measure up nor anything else. Yet, we often expect people to act in ways that are not part of an unreformed life. Judgement and accusations fly freely with no thought of their validity. Jesus calls this blindness. If you ever wanted a gospel message in a short, explainable way, this is it. You will learn about the key...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

Life of faith starts with redemption, not with commandments, not with right living, and not with trying to measure up nor anything else. Yet, we often expect people to act in ways that are not part of an unreformed life. Judgement and accusations fly freely with no thought of their validity. Jesus calls this blindness. 

If you ever wanted a gospel message in a short, explainable way, this is it. You will learn about the key verse that will change the way you approach others and your perception of your relationship with God. 

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Real, Hard Look
item.title: Real, Hard Look
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. A very difficult message to hear. The church has become complacent, individualistic in nature and mostly a consumer driven model. It has not led, cast a correct vision, nor stood for anything relevant. That is not how it used to be. There are challenges and difficulties along with obstacles and other influencers we must navigate. That process starts with this message. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: The First Easter
item.title: The First Easter
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. There is a lot of bad theology around the crucifixion and raising of Jesus Christ from the dead. Today’s message, taken from Psalm 22, is a powerful insight into where things went wrong and how to put good theology in its place. It will challenge you, but it will also help you understand the truth. Because of that, it is an important message you need to hear. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Restrained By Culture
item.title: Restrained By Culture
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. How we were raised, our environment, and the world around us have all told us what to believe and how to believe it. We all relate to the world around us either on individual or collective motive. It depends on our culture, and each motive has its drawbacks and advantages. It is not uncommon to find we don’t understand things because we are limited in our awareness. Today’s message helps us to redefine the different ways people ...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

How we were raised, our environment, and the world around us have all told us what to believe and how to believe it. We all relate to the world around us either on individual or collective motive. It depends on our culture, and each motive has its drawbacks and advantages.

It is not uncommon to find we don’t understand things because we are limited in our awareness. Today’s message helps us to redefine the different ways people communicate, how we understand our world, and how we relate to God. This is not to be missed, as it is truly helpful.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Raise the Question
item.title: Raise the Question
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Jesus makes a very clear statement that is immediately overlooked. He then repeats it two more times to make sure they hear it. For some reason, what He said is not questioned or considered. Today, we consider it. If you wondered about your life in eternity, this is the one for you. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Relatively Speaking
item.title: Relatively Speaking
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Powerful message. Jesus begins the process of discernment between “believers” and followers who are true disciples. Do you know which you are? Do you believe or follow? The difference matters to Jesus, and since it matters to Him, wouldn’t it matter to you? Don’t be complacent in your walk. If you are, here’s a wake up. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. By far one of the most challenging and important messages I have ever shared. The communion service had me in tears trying to share the impact of what Jesus did. Try to listen to the whole message without tearing up! item.itunes:title: Remove the Bias (In 4 Easy Steps)
item.title: Remove the Bias (In 4 Easy Steps)
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. We have first impressions and quick decisions, and we think we are correct in what we believe. However, the research shows that we have a personal bias in most every area of our life. This affects relationships, our understanding of the world, and our understanding of ourselves. If we could change that, our lives and world would be better places and safer for others to interact with us. This message talks about bias in peo...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

We have first impressions and quick decisions, and we think we are correct in what we believe. However, the research shows that we have a personal bias in most every area of our life. This affects relationships, our understanding of the world, and our understanding of ourselves. If we could change that, our lives and world would be better places and safer for others to interact with us. 

This message talks about bias in people at the time of Jesus, how it relates to you, and four practical steps to make a change... if you’re ready and willing. 

Support the show

www.Turning180.com
item.content:encoded:

item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

This is a celebration to end all celebrations. It is one of the most celebrated times of the year and it has implications for you and me. It is not something that may be familiar to you, but has wonderful intonations for your life.  What is it? It is the Feast of Tabernacles. Jesus attended it in the gospel of John in chapters 7 and 8. In this message, we see how we can start a party in our lives and in our hearts, which celebrates the joy of redemption and freedom from bondage.
2/14/2021
You can also watch this message at www.lookingup.live

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

Jrtstudio@yahoo.com is my email. Www.Lookingup.live is the YouTube link.

item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

Thank you for listening to this podcast! This one has a special message at the very beginning for anyone listening online, including you. If this is your first time listening, let me know where you’re from. If you have listened before, let me know by email that you’re listening and if there’s anything I can do for you.

This is the last challenge and response by Jesus in John chapter 7. We use this text as a introduction to communion unlike any other communion offered by me or anyone I’ve ever experienced it from. This also has the element of a challenge to us, to you especially, if you claim relationship with Jesus or you do not. This message speaks to both people who believe in Jesus and people who do not.

Grab some communion elements and join us as this is a part of this message. There is also a special message at the beginning to those who listen online.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

If you are brave and daring, let Jesus’ challenge apply to you today. This message will leave you uncomfortable ...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

As we consider what Jesus said to those who are confronting him, these same conceptions they had are yours today as well. It is very uncomfortable to hear Jesus respond to them the way he would respond to you. But, this message helps you to heal and restore those proper relationships that you have let go astray. 

If you are brave and daring, let Jesus’ challenge apply to you today. This message will leave you uncomfortable and make you squirm. Even the one who spoke it said that it was difficult for him to hear and deliver this message.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Riposte #1
item.title: Riposte #1
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. In fencing, a riposte is when someone stabs at you and you block it and immediately lunch back. When Jesus is confronted or challenged, he does this same kind of maneuver in a very powerful way. Today we look at the first of several found in John chapter 7. His art of responding and challenging in return speaks to us today. The things that others thought of back then about Jesus are also true in many ways for us. Let us no...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

In fencing, a riposte is when someone stabs at you and you block it and immediately lunch back. When Jesus is confronted or challenged, he does this same kind of maneuver in a very powerful way. Today we look at the first of several found in John chapter 7. 

His art of responding and challenging in return speaks to us today. The things that others thought of back then about Jesus are also true in many ways for us. Let us not get complacent in our relationship with Jesus Christ as we have also put a challenge to him that he will have to respond back to us individually.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Rhema vs. Logos
item.title: Rhema vs. Logos
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. We say we believe in God. We say we do what he says. When we hear from God and instruction the challenges us, do we wait or act? There are words and scripture which are called ‘logos’ and there are words about things in scripture or they give you life internally from the Holy Spirit that are called ‘rhema.’ This message will help you discern which is which. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. We often question what God says even when we know better. item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. 5-Star sermon! From John 5:1-15. Excellent and powerful message not to be missed. If you’ve ever wondered what your life might turn out like, whether or not you are drawing people in or pushing them away, or if you were waiting for a deeper healing from Jesus, this message is for you. In other words, this message is for us all! Pastor Jonathan tells the story with deep insights into the healing, the dynamics, the era and ...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

5-Star sermon! From John 5:1-15. Excellent and powerful message not to be missed. 

If you’ve ever wondered what your life might turn out like, whether or not you are drawing people in or pushing them away, or if you were waiting for a deeper healing from Jesus, this message is for you. In other words, this message is for us all!

Pastor Jonathan tells the story with deep insights into the healing, the dynamics, the era and how it relates to today for your life. There is practical application and motivation which will help you be a better person starting today.

This is a dynamic message you will want to listen to over and over again and share with your friends.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Rooted Behavior
item.title: Rooted Behavior
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Faith comes by hearing. When you tell your testimony of what God has done, it comes across with the authority of the word of God and can transform lives. You are familiar with your own life and what God has done for you. It is not difficult to tell a story the of what God has done to you and through you or for you. When you do this, you have glorified Jesus Christ. Some want to make sharing the gospel hard. It would take s...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

Faith comes by hearing. When you tell your testimony of what God has done, it comes across with the authority of the word of God and can transform lives. You are familiar with your own life and what God has done for you. It is not difficult to tell a story the of what God has done to you and through you or for you. When you do this, you have glorified Jesus Christ. 

Some want to make sharing the gospel hard. It would take some learning to memorize scriptures and how to lead someone to Jesus, but it’s not so hard to talk about your story. If God hasn’t done something for you lately, you may want to re-evaluate what you believe about what God does. Update your testimony and start sharing it.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. This is a 5-Star sermon! You will want to listen to it, and listen to it again later. You will want to bookmark it for a reminder in case you forget what it shares. You may think you do not make assumptions, but you would be mistaken. Breaking that habit and pattern is not easy. This message will help you. This message finds us looking at our assumptions. And, when our pastor said he makes assumptions, it was n...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

This is a 5-Star sermon! You will want to listen to it, and listen to it again later. You will want to bookmark it for a reminder in case you forget what it shares. You may think you do not make assumptions, but you would be mistaken.  Breaking that habit and pattern is not easy. This message will help you.
  
This message finds us looking at our assumptions. And, when our pastor said he makes assumptions, it was not surprising to find they are the same ones most people make. When you listen to the sermon, take notes, and listen to it again. You will want to learn this principle.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: River
item.title: River
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From John 3:18-21 comes a stunning message with a strong challenge. Pastor Jonathan sees the world as a river flowing away from God toward eternal destruction. The flow is so slow that people don’t even realize they are moving away from God and gradually deteriorating. Our task is to turn around in the river by the grace of God to face towards God, and then bring others with us upstream toward Jesus. The flow of people in ...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

From John 3:18-21 comes a stunning message with a strong challenge. Pastor Jonathan sees the world as a river flowing away from God toward eternal destruction. The flow is so slow that people don’t even realize they are moving away from God and gradually deteriorating. 

Our task is to turn around in the river by the grace of God to face towards God, and then bring others with us upstream toward Jesus. The flow of people in society is against our task as they continually flow downstream, and makes our efforts at helping them turn around a hard task to do. If we face Jesus and do not bring others with us or move toward Jesus, then we are also floating downstream even while looking at Jesus. We are to be “River Raiders“ and live that out every day.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.title: Remedial Mind John 3:16-17
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. We live in a world that likes to condemn one another. We don’t call what we do condemnation as we look at our world, but we will look at it in judgment. This judgment stems from an attitude of condemnation. This did not come from Jesus, as He did not come to condemn. He came to free and restore people back to God. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Reptilian Mind
item.title: Reptilian Mind
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, so Jesus said he must be lifted up as well. The reason Moses lifted up the serpent was the people who belonged to God were snake bit. We also are snake bit, with the sting of the serpent’s bite of sin. Because of this bite, we have a mind that is bent on sin and not on Jesus. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.title: Romans 1:16-19
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Paul states he is not shamed of the gospel of Christ. What is the gospel? What does Paul see might be wrong in our theology and understanding of salvation? Why does he say there should be no unbelief in God? Is he being overzealous or showing us a different scenario of what we are to embrace as truth? If you ever wondered if you are worth redeeming or if being loved, this will take those questions off your plate. The last ...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

Paul states he is not shamed of the gospel of Christ. What is the gospel? What does Paul see might be wrong in our theology and understanding of salvation? Why does he say there should be no unbelief in God? Is he being overzealous or showing us a different scenario of what we are to embrace as truth? 

If you ever wondered if you are worth redeeming or if being loved, this will take those questions off your plate. The last 20 minutes will radically change your understanding of redemption, unless you already know why God Really sent his son. 

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.title: Reborn John 3:1-3 July 26, 2020
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Nicodemus comes to Jesus and shows him proper respect. Jesus offers a statement that seems to contradict what was said. But, a closer look reveals the reality of what Jesus said and what these three important verses reveal. They show us our own spiritually undersight and how the church has misrepresented the gospel. Listen and see if you agree! Support the show www.Turning180.com
item.description:

Listen and see if you agree!

item.itunes:title: Man’s Best
item.title: Man’s Best
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Of all the things to be confident about in our life, most of them come from an earthly perspective. Many things such as our lineage, heritage, and ancestry, are things we had nothing to do with but to be born. Yet, we use these things as ways to determine our value. This message will let you know those ways don’t work with Jesus. #ChurchUp Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Devastated
item.title: Devastated
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. I went way outside of my comfort zone to preach this message. I heard it was a hellfire and brimstone type of sermon. I don’t think I’ve ever done that before. All I know is Jesus Christ must be the center of life or we are delusional thinking we are Christian. Many ‘Christians’ sure don’t act like or even know what it means to be one. If you think I am talking about other people, you are incorrect. I am talking about myself. I s...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

I went way outside of my comfort zone to preach this message. I heard it was a hellfire and brimstone type of sermon. I don’t think I’ve ever done that before. All I know is Jesus Christ must be the center of life or we are delusional thinking we are Christian. Many ‘Christians’ sure don’t act like or even know what it means to be one. If you think I am talking about other people, you are incorrect. I am talking about myself. I spoke this sermon to myself as I was “devastated” by the truth God was showing me about me. This passage from the book of James really challenged me to take a good, long, hard look at myself.

If you believe you are a follower of Jesus Christ, then listen to this message and consider what is said. The response to it was overwhelming. I believe it will be for you, too. 

.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com
item.content:encoded:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

I went way outside of my comfort zone to preach this message. I heard it was a hellfire and brimstone type of sermon. I don’t think I’ve ever done that before. All I know is Jesus Christ must be the center of life or we are delusional thinking we are Christian. Many ‘Christians’ sure don’t act like or even know what it means to be one. If you think I am talking about other people, you are incorrect. I am talking about myself. I spoke this sermon to myself as I was “devastated” by the truth God was showing me about me. This passage from the book of James really challenged me to take a good, long, hard look at myself.

If you believe you are a follower of Jesus Christ, then listen to this message and consider what is said. The response to it was overwhelming. I believe it will be for you, too. 

.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Self Promotion
item.title: Self Promotion
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. This sermon asks the question what makes you think you are God? You may feel like you do not think you are God, but you most likely do. This message made the audience and the speaker very uncomfortable. It reveals truth about our pride, ego, and self centeredness. It also shows the way to live a godly life, what God wills for us, and the three things not to respond to God’s will with. Listen and prayerfully consider this me...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

This sermon asks the question what makes you think you are God? You may feel like you do not  think you are God, but you most likely do. This message made the audience and the speaker very uncomfortable. It reveals truth about our pride, ego, and self centeredness. It also shows the way to live a godly life, what God wills for us, and the three things not to respond to God’s will with. Listen and prayerfully consider this message.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.title: Your Part
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Too often we get frustrated in life because we keep trying to do God’s job instead of ours, and asking God to do our job instead of us doing it. This message will help you move beyond being a false believer in Jesus Christ and into the realm of true believers if you do what James suggests. Listen and share. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Our journey through the book of Philippians continues in chapter 2. In these verses we look at how we are light bearing believers. Paul’s words to this particular church will help you understand what it means to “bear the word of life” and to be willing to be a poured out drink offering for Jesus. You will learn the true purpose of emotions in this message also. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Lining Up
item.title: Lining Up
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. We ask for a lot of things, but they do not come. If you’ve ever wondered why this was true for you, this message will help you understand. It is my prayer that you will listen, consider, and then change some things. The three-step process at the end is priceless and will help you make the choice you need to make. Listen to the entire sermon to get to those three steps. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Two Versus One
item.title: Two Versus One
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. We have two ears and one mouth. We have two hands, two eyes and one heart. We have two feet, two arms and one mind. Our angry agenda won’t get God’s work done. What choice are you going to make? To love or to serve selfish interests? There is only one way and one truth for a follower of Jesus. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Love Is
item.title: Love Is
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Vision Sunday!! In today’s message we learn we have an agenda we need to be aware of and to remove the harmful aspects of it. I do not mean your schedule and your planner, and I don’t mean your business meetings. Agenda is the stuff in your head which activates in every relationship. It is to the Kingdom of God’s detriment you keep this agenda and claim love of God and others. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Shadowless
item.title: Shadowless
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Every familiar story has components that often get overlooked because we travel to the conclusion without pondering the journey. Our life is familiar to us, so we think how we think and feel how we feel without consideration as to whether those things are still a part of the story being woven in our life now. Much like auto pilot, we let go of the wheel and focus on other things. Today’s message takes an often told story a...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

Every familiar story has components that often get overlooked because we travel to the conclusion without pondering the journey. Our life is familiar to us, so we think how we think and feel how we feel without consideration as to whether those things are still a part of the story being woven in our life now. Much like auto pilot, we let go of the wheel and focus on other things. 

Today’s message takes an often told story and pauses to consider aspects relevant to why the story is being told. You will not hear the prodigal son story the same way again. 

The nuances hidden in it are numerous. This message is the first of two detailing aspects of the story that directly relate to your life. Even if you listen to this message more than once, deeper truths hidden inside of you will spring to the surface each time. It is relevant to where you are in life no matter where you are. 

Part two, which I will preach April 7, changed my (Jonathan Althoff) thinking so profoundly I cannot think of another day without noticing a greater joy. I pray you listen to this one and then jump into the next one when it’s done. I must warn you, just because it is about a familiar story -yours and the prodigal son- those stories are about to change for you!

I love you and pray for your listening. 

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

Since the time of Christ, centuries have gone by. We cannot think in terms of millennium or centuries. We are programmed to our date and time. This is good and detrimental. We have our individual bias which causes us to understand and interpret things in our own individualized and peculiar way. But, what are we missing? What part of the stories of days gone by are lost to us? This message is but one look into a small part of what we are missing. 

Support the show

item.title: Authentic
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. A real God, a real faith and real answers: those are often missing in our lives. Looking at Moses and Mt. Sinai, Hebrews compares this to Mt. Zion and Jesus with the awareness that the first Mountain gave us the law and the second ushered in grace and forgiveness. Which one do you prefer? One ends in condemnation and the other in redemption. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Church?
item.title: Church?
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Many are disillusioned with what has been called church. If the church is about self preservation and being a social club, then their distaste is warranted. But, what if a church dared to be the real church as was intended? What does that look like? Can this church be that kind of church? All those answers and more are in this powerful message shared on Vision Sunday. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: End Of The Road?
item.title: End Of The Road?
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. We see things failing or falling apart and wonder if this is the end. “Where can God be and why isn’t He doing anything?” we wonder. It can make a skeptic out of a strong believer, especially if they don’t know the truth disclosed in this message. Listen for a deeply personal look into one man’s struggle with his own skepticism and journey through it. It may well be what you need to move into full conviction of your faith. Suppor...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

We see things failing or falling apart and wonder if this is the end. “Where can God be and why isn’t He doing anything?” we wonder. It can make a skeptic out of a strong believer, especially if they don’t know the truth disclosed in this message. Listen for a deeply personal look into one man’s struggle with his own skepticism and journey through it. It may well be what you need to move into full conviction of your faith.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com
item.content:encoded:

Listen for a deeply personal look into one man’s struggle with his own skepticism and journey through it. It may well be what you need to move into full conviction of your faith.

item.itunes:title: Teleo
item.title: Teleo
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. When Jesus died on the cross he said, “Teleo.” It is translated as it is finished. What was finished? The work he could do as a human. Something else was about to start. There was a necessary ending that created necessary beginnings. We are now living in the finished and unfinished work of the cross. What is that? Listen and apply!Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Incomparable
item.title: Incomparable
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. We say we have a relationship with Jesus and we offer reasons. But, what is the most valuable possession you have and how does it compare? What is important to you and why? Where does Jesus rank in your itinerary, your time, your conversations, your thoughts, and your giving? Is He Lord or a good idea? This message will help you sort out those questions and answers. Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Follow Me
item.title: Follow Me
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Jesus calls us to be disciples with specific instructions, but he doesn’t say the one thing which his original audience understood. It is crucial to understanding what is involved in discipleship and why. If you feel like you are missing something in your life, this should help you understand what it is and what to do about it. Support the show www.Turning180.com

A believer in Jesus produces Kingdom fruit for the glory of God. The harvest will increase over time. If it does not exist or is not increasing, it is evidence of a dead faith. Dead faith is a problem. Don’t live with it.

Support the show

item.itunes:title: Born of Spirit
item.title: Born of Spirit
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Matthew 1:18-20 All creation runs through Jesus Christ… History is Hisstory… Human history (John 1:1-3)John 3:5-6 two types of birth: Born again means born of spirit. It does not mean you said a prayer or made a choice. It means God has done a work in you by the Holy Spirit that you now know you could not do. Rom 12:2 to have a transformation: to B180. You have new heart born into you by Holy Spirit, or still what you use to be. ...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

Matthew 1:18-20 All creation runs through Jesus Christ… History is Hisstory… Human history (John 1:1-3)John 3:5-6 two types of birth: Born again means born of spirit. It does not mean you said a prayer or made a choice. It means God has done a work in you by the Holy Spirit that you now know you could not do. Rom 12:2 to have a transformation: to B180. You have new heart born into you by Holy Spirit, or still what you use to be. Why spiritually reborn? Cuz born into Adam! That life is death, new life in Christ is because he is the new Adam (I Cor 15:44-49).He has born a new desire in you. I Cor 13:12 to desire to be like Him! 2 Cor 5:17: a new creation you are. Of Spirit you are born. Learning a new way of relating to yourself, others, God and the world is your task. Not born of spirit and belonging to Jesus Christ doesn’t mean the war isn’t going on as the lineage still exists!Romans 8:5-11 spirit and flesh are at war. This is why you desire control! Satan knows God won’t bless that!We are no longer carnally minded (1 Cor 3:1-3) Flesh cannot understand what I am talking about. (I Cor 2:14) Choices are simplified… does it glorify God? Is it helpful/uplifting? If not, squelch thoughts, words or ideas of carnal nature. Have you a need to seek God to help youchange your thought patterns? You cannot do this by choice; again, it is by the Spiritof God.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Crafted
item.title: Crafted
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. Jesus was born in Bethlehem and as of the lineage of king David. Each person has a family tree which, if traceable, would go back to the first man, Adam. Tracing Jesus’ genealogy before David, we find Adam for him also. We are connected that way in the human race as under the rules of humanity. At Calvary, Jesus made a way for us to be connected to him another way. How? Was it the first time? Those answers and more are found in ...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

Jesus was born in Bethlehem and as of the lineage of king David. Each person has a family tree which, if traceable, would go back to the first man, Adam. Tracing Jesus’ genealogy before David, we find Adam for him also. We are connected that way in the human race as under the rules of humanity. At Calvary, Jesus made a way for us to be connected to him another way. How? Was it the first time? Those answers and more are found in this stirring delivery. This important message is the first of four in the “Identified” series.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.title: Anxious Thoughts
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. The HEAL series continues with the ‘A’ sermon, “Anxious Thoughts.” It is not uncommon to be anxious or have anxiety. At times, it can be debilitating. It comes from a threat in our lives. Philippians 4 gives you some practical tools on how to handle it, how to harness it, and its true purpose. You can fight, flight or freeze when anxiety and fear comes, or you can do what it’s supposed to make you do. Some biblical examples help ...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

The HEAL series continues with the ‘A’ sermon, “Anxious Thoughts.” It is not uncommon to be anxious or have anxiety. At times, it can be debilitating. It comes from a threat in our lives. Philippians 4 gives you some practical tools on how to handle it, how to harness it, and its true purpose. You can fight, flight or freeze when anxiety and fear comes, or you can do what it’s supposed to make you do. Some biblical examples help us on this journey to HEAL in this area of our lives.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Not Not Sin
item.title: Not Not Sin
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. By request comes this poignant sermon from April 2014. Most of the harshest criticism against Christianity is that a Christian doesn't walk out their faith. However, a true Christian is known by their fruit, not by their perfect walking out of Christianity. Many people think a Christian ought to walk their faith perfectly, but they are not Jesus Christ.This message details belief in Jesus Christ and what it would do. Just as Alco...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

By request comes this poignant sermon from April 2014. Most of the harshest criticism against Christianity is that a Christian doesn't walk out their faith. However, a true Christian is known by their fruit, not by their perfect walking out of Christianity. Many people think a Christian ought to walk their faith perfectly, but they are not Jesus Christ.This message details belief in Jesus Christ and what it would do. Just as Alcoholics Anonymous is not about not drinking, Christianity is not about not sinning. If an alcoholic does not get to the 12th step, he will remain stuck in his problems. If a Christian does not move beyond trying not to sin, they will also get stuck.In other words, recovery, Christianity, and anything worth doing, ultimately is not about you. It is about a life of giving and loving. If you do not understand this, or do not believe this, then I understand why you would not want to listen to this message. It would get you out of your comfort zone and maybe help you not be so self focused. And, if you were not so self focused, you might change the world. Of course, that might take some work. And people might criticize you. But it's worth it.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com
item.content:encoded:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

item.itunes:title: Nearsighted
item.title: Nearsighted
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From January 15, 2017. Isaiah 49 is a prophetic notice to anyone who will listen that they are being trivial in their view of life. God sees the big picture, which includes Satan's four lies and the failure of Jesus to do His originally stated plan. We all face life without knowing the true intent of God for His purposes. This is why we try to make our own. This sermon helps debunk all that.Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: No Fish
item.title: No Fish
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From December 4, 2016. Jesus fed 4,000 and 5,000 plus people, and all ate til they were filled. There were leftovers by the basketful on both occasions. However, there was only one kind of leftover with the other food mysteriously produced and consumed in exact amounts. Was the leftovers a mistake? Was the lack of leftover fish a mistake? In other words, why was there bread left but no fish?Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.title: Ask Again
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From November 13, 2016. Have you ever wondered about the culture at the time of Jesus? What is different about how they heard the gospel and how we do? There are many distinct differences in awareness levels they had due to cultural differences. What they heard compared to what we think is being said can transform the story completely. For deeper insights into how they lived, read Bruce Malina or John Pilch. You can also start by...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

From November 13, 2016. Have you ever wondered about the culture at the time of Jesus? What is different about how they heard the gospel and how we do? There are many distinct differences in awareness levels they had due to cultural differences. What they heard compared to what we think is being said can transform the story completely. For deeper insights into how they lived, read Bruce Malina or John Pilch. You can also start by listening to this sermon. It's not what you think the title might say it is, it is something we in the USA miss in our cultural diversity.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

You may need a pencil or pen to take some notes.Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Audience Of One
item.title: Audience Of One
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From April 2015. Crazy David acting like a fool. Yet he kept on dancing and carrying on like nobody was watching. Yet, there were perhaps thousands observing his behavior. Why didn't he stop? Why did he keep going? Maybe he was the only one who could hear the music? Listen and find out more of the story.Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Looking Through
item.title: Looking Through
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From July 17, 2016. We have lost our sense of peace and stability in this world. We have a need to find out what we can do to get it back. God calls each of us out of our comfort zones to go and do. We resist until we find that resisting is more disruptive to our lives than accepting the call. This message touches on both of these realities.Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.title: The Cascades
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From March of 2014. Great message that has been requested to be posted. One of those classics that many have drawn on to teach these principles to others. I imagine you are living in a cascade right now and don't even know it. It happens subtly. What is a cascade? It is an automatic response to any stimulus that does not line up with the truth of who you are in Christ. This and the sermon "Looking Through" have similar themes. Li...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

From March of 2014. Great message that has been requested to be posted. One of those classics that many have drawn on to teach these principles to others. I imagine you are living in a cascade right now and don't even know it. It happens subtly. What is a cascade? It is an automatic response to any stimulus that does not line up with the truth of who you are in Christ. This and the sermon "Looking Through" have similar themes. Listen to both back to back.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.title: He's Gone Fishing
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From August 30, 2015. I spoke this message with a cane in my hand. You cannot see the moments when I am taking on the persona of the disciple named Peter, but visually I had the cane in my hand and was acting his role. I hope it translates to this audio sermon. If it does, you will understand why this is a sermon about being very desperate.Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.title: Leveling Even
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From June 26, 2016. item.title: The Crucible
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From February 2014. This is one of the most listen to and requested sermons I have ever shared. It is from a few years ago and is not a part of the Turning 180 series. However, it fits perfectly in with the rest of the sermons. I challenge you to listen to this message and understand why the most important thing you can do when going through a struggle or a trial is ask God to make it worse. There is a reason you were going throu...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

From February 2014. This is one of the most listen to and requested sermons I have ever shared. It is from a few years ago and is not a part of the Turning 180 series. However, it fits perfectly in with the rest of the sermons. I challenge you to listen to this message and understand why the most important thing you can do when going through a struggle or a trial is ask God to make it worse. There is a reason you were going through what you're going through. This message will clearly share with you why and what to do about it.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Rising To Fail
item.title: Rising To Fail
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. There are a few moments in my life where a radical difference happened. This sermon is one of those moments that helped me to overcome fears. If you are having trouble moving forward in life or with fear and anxiety, this may be the one you have been looking for. This sermon is a few years old, but it is one of my personal favorites. Because it helps us turn our lives around, I include it now in the Turning 180 series.Support the...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

There are a few moments in my life where a radical difference happened. This sermon is one of those moments that helped me to overcome fears. If you are having trouble moving forward in life or with fear and anxiety, this may be the one you have been looking for. This sermon is a few years old, but it is one of my personal favorites. Because it helps us turn our lives around, I include it now in the Turning 180 series.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Be 180
item.title: Be 180
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From November 8, 2015. A classic message in the early part of the Turning 180 series. All the messages with 180 in their title and the "Be One" are from a time when our church was experiencing a massive outpouring of grace and miracles. This message clearly shows our obligation to be one of the 180 people. After you listen to it, let me know if you are one of the 180. I am!Support the show www.Turning180.com

Although this is...
item.description:
Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening.

From October 4, 2015. This is the sermon that started it all! Listen to the sermon before you listen to any of the others. This WILL make you think, challenge you in ways that you may have never been challenged before and humble you. This sermon from October 2015 will indeed show you the beginning of the Turning 180 series. After the sermon was over, miracles, revival, hope and a new energy flowed in our church. Although this is not the Turning 180 signature sermon, it is the one that made it all happen. It is a MUST listen on a regular basis.Even our pastor found new life and energy from this message. It was what began the 180 transformation.

Support the show

www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Leveling Up
item.title: Leveling Up
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From June 12, 2016. We often get stuck in the faith with no way to get moving. We lose sight of the direction we thought God was moving us. We stop growing and maturing. This message will get you back on track and restore your hope in the process, but only if you listen to it!Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Lightning
item.title: Lightning
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From June 5, 2016. The transformation that God is doing in you must be assessed and evaluated from time to time. We tend to get off track easily. This message brings you back to where it all matters. The question "What matters to you?" is addressed. We get back to the transformative nature of the Turning 180 series with this message.Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Living Now
item.title: Living Now
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From May 29, 2016. The Zombie Passage in Matthew 27, the death of Lazarus, Moses at the burning bush and the Transfiguration of Jesus all have something in common. The question is, do you have a true relationship with Jesus? This will help you answer that question. This is in the Turning 180 sermon series and this one may help you get over the faith/doubt hump you always seem to face.Support the show www.Turning180.com

item.itunes:title: Living Known
item.title: Living Known
item.itunes:summary: Connect with me here in text… tell me where you are listening. From May 1, 2016. When all we want is to know that somebody sees us and understands us, it can feel like a very lonely place. Jesus is aware of that. He alone has the ability to see you as you truly are. This is one of those messages where you feel loved and understood. I hope you enjoy it and can find hope and strength.Support the show www.Turning180.com
